meanings.definition: To control or limit something, such as an impulse or behavior.
meanings.sent1: She is curbing her desire to eat sweets to stay healthy.
meanings.sent2: Parents often use rules to help in curbing their children's misbehavior.
meanings.sent3: By curbing her spending, she was able to save money for a vacation.
meanings.sent4: The strict teacher was curbing any disruptions in the classroom.
meanings.sent5: He felt proud of himself for curbing his anger during the argument.

meanings.definition: A border or edging, typically made of stone or concrete, along the edge of a street or sidewalk.
meanings.sent1: The city installed new curbing to improve the appearance of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: She tripped over the curbing while walking on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy kept jumping over the curbing in the park.
meanings.sent4: The curbing along the road prevented cars from driving onto the grass.
meanings.sent5: The curbing was painted white to make it more visible to pedestrians.
